page.title: 06RIVERS
page.content: There are three rivers running through Braintree. The Blackwater, Pant and Brain. The river Pant becomes the Blackwater once it has passed Convent Lane. The river Brain eventually joins the Blackwater before it reaches Maldon and its mouth at Bradwell. The rivers are still relatively small as they pass through Braintree and are attractive with unaltered courses and natural banks and vegetation. There are footpaths along most of the lengths of the rivers. Some are tarmac to provide easy access for everyone. Along the Blackwater Willow, Oak, Hawthorn, Sloe, Hazel and Dogrose were spotted. A variety of wild flowers were found Cows Parsely, Mulen, Wild parsnip, Comfrey, Mouse eared chickweed, Curled Dock and Ragged Robin.
